div.script:
$(document).ready(function () {
        var logConsole = function (str) {
            console.log(str);
        };
        if ($('#tabPortlet_575664 .divTabEdit').val() == "True") {
            var isModern = ('True');
            if(isModern.toLowerCase() == "true")
            {
                var tabObj = $('#tabPortlet_575664 ');
                var tabM = $('#ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl11_divTabs').attr('portlet') == 'tab';

                function activate() {
                    $(tabObj).scrollingTabs({                 
                        tabs: [{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl11_divTabs_0","title":"April 15th Press Release","content":"
PRESS RELEASE\n
For Immediate Release\n
 \n
DATE:  April 15, 2020\n
 \n
From:  Curtis M. Clough, Associate Superintendent\n
To: All Media Outlets for Silver City/Grant County Outlet\n
 \n
With feedback from our parents and community, Silver Consolidated School District is creating two distribution times for parents/students to pick up the learning packets so not to interfere with meal distribution times for the Continuous Learning Plan.   Because of increased numbers of requests for paper packets, the District is offering a drive thru pickup in the rear parking lot of the Board Office at 2810 North Swan Street on Tuesday, April 21, 2020.  Grades 1-8 will be available from 4:30PM – 6:00PM with Grades 9-12 distributed from 6:30PM – 8:00PM.  Signs will be posted directing drivers to the correct pick up location and those who are picking up for multiple students can drive thru any line and an individual will assist in the distribution of all materials for your student(s).  If a conflict exists with a family commitment or work schedule, parents can do drive thru pick up at either time and every effort will be made to distribute the materials in a timely manner.  This will be the final distribution for the rest of the school year with no other mass distributions scheduled.\n
 \n
If you are unable to make these times, please contact your teacher or building administrator for assistance and potential options for pick up. The district wants to provide your student every opportunity to be successful in this difficult time and will work with you to get access to the learning materials your student needs.\n
 \n
NOTE:  For parents who have been contacted by our Special Education Department, your supplies and materials will also be available in the same time slots for pickup.  Any questions may be directed to the student’s teacher or the Special Education Department.\n
 \n
For Cliff Families:  Please contact the administration as they are coordinating efforts with families to assist in a variety of activities.  \n
 ","active":true,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl11_divTabs_1","title":"April 8th Press Press Release","content":"
PRESS RELEASE\n
For Immediate Release\n
 \n
DATE:  April 7, 2020\n
 \n
From:  Curtis M. Clough, Associate Superintendent (on behalf of Mr. Brown)\n
To: All Media Outlets for Silver City/Grant County Outlet\n
 \n
Silver Consolidated School District would like to thank the parents and community members for the patience in the first day of the distribution of the instructional packets for our students.  Because of increased numbers of the request for paper packets and parents who were unable to make today’s times, the District is offering a drive thru pickup in the rear parking lot of the Board Office at 2810 North Swan Street from 5:00 – 7:00PM on Wednesday, April 8.  Signs will be posted directing drivers to the correct pick up location and those who are picking up for multiple students can drive thru any line and an individual will assist in the distribution of all materials for your student(s).  To make the process flow smoothly, we ask that parents have the following information ready for assistance in the pickup procedures:\n
 \n\n    
Student(s) Grade Level for Grades 1-8\n    
For HS Students:List of Subjects the Student is currently taking\n    \n        
Please consult your student on the Subjects he or she is taking as the packets are based by content area in the following areas:ELA, Math, Science, Social Studies, Career and Tech Ed (CTE) and Electives (ex. Art, Band, etc.)\n    \n    \n\n
 \n
NOTE:  For parents who have been contacted by our Special Education Department, your supplies and materials will also be available in the same time slot for pickup.\n
 \n
Packets are not based by building, but by grade level or subject areas your student is currently enrolled.  The activities in the packet are being done districtwide and mirror the online learning that is occurring for students currently using Google Classroom.\n
 \n
For Cliff Families:  Please contact the administration as they are coordinating efforts with families to assist in a variety of activities.  \n
 \n
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact your teacher or school building for assistance.","active":false,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl11_divTabs_2","title":"Online Resources","content":"
Families Distance Learning Toolkit\n
\n\tWhile schools are closed, many families may choose to supplement daily activities with online learning for their students.  Families looking for some optional online learning support, may consider these free resources.
\n
\nCommon Sense Media Resources for Parents\n
\n\tNavigating social distancing and school closures with quality media and at home learning opportunities for your kids.
\n
\n
\nSilver Schools - Clever
\n
\n\tStudents can login through Clever at home to access many of the school district's online programs, like iStation, Lexia, Moby Max, Renaissance Learning, etc.  Students use their district Google account to login.
\n
\nState of New Mexico - I Need Assistance Page
\n
\n\tThis page has resources and answers to questions on a wide range of topics affecting our students and families during this time.
\n","active":false,"disabled":false}],// required,
                        propPaneId: 'paneId', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propTitle: 'title', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propActive: 'active', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propDisabled: 'disabled', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        propContent: 'content', // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        tabMode : tabM,
                        scrollToTabEdge: false, // optional - pass in default value for demo purposes
                        disableScrollArrowsOnFullyScrolled: false // optional- pass in default value for demo purposes
                    }).on('ready.scrtabs', function() {
                        $('#'+this.id+' .tab-pane').attr('tabindex',0);
                    });
                };

                activate();
            }
        }
    });

input.name: ctl00$ContentPlaceHolder1$ctl15$hfCanUseMultiSelect

div.style: float: right; position: absolute; display: none

p.strong: If you are needing to finish the registration process for the 2019-2020 school year, please visit the PowerSchool Registration Website. This information is extremely important for our school district because it includes updated contact and medical information that assist the district in the event of an emergency.

div.p: Are you looking for the closest bus stop for your child? Do you need to know if our busses service your area? Look no further than our 2019-2020 Bus Route Schedule. Click on the title to open the bus routes for the upcoming school year. If you have questions about a bus route, please contact Sandra Estrada, at 575-956-2000.

em.span: Welcome to the online home of Silver Consolidated School District! Located in the vibrant, historical region of southwest New Mexico, we provide a top quality public education for the families of Silver City, Cliff, Gila, Pinos Altos, Tyrone, and White Signal. Our highly qualified teachers, excellent staff, and supportive families help us achieve our commitment to provide each student in our care with a foundation for lifelong success.

a.title: Silver Consolidated Schools
a.div:
2810 N. Swan St., Silver City, NM 88061
Phone 575-956-2000 | Fax 575-956-2039
